statement.title: Problem Description
statement.content: Each course grade is one of the following five letters: A, B, C, D, and F. (Note that there is no grade E.) The grade A indicates superior achievement , whereas F stands for failure. In order to calculate the GPA, the letter grades A, B, C, D, and F are assigned the following grade points, respectively: 4, 3, 2, 1, and 0.

statement.title: Input
statement.content: The input file will contain data for one or more test cases, one test case per line. On each line there will be one or more upper case letters, separated by blank spaces.

statement.title: Output
statement.content: Each line of input will result in exactly one line of output. If all upper case letters on a particular line of input came from the set {A, B, C, D, F} then the output will consist of the GPA, displayed with a precision of two decimal places. Otherwise, the message "Unknown letter grade in input" will be printed.

statement.title: Sample Input
statement.content:
A B C D F
B F F C C A
D C E F

statement.title: Sample Output
statement.content:
2.00
1.83
Unknown letter grade in input
